intro: Monophyllaea longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed monophyllaea, is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to South Africa, characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces clusters of pale yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture, contributing to its ornamental value in garden settings.
